name: 高級語音學
comment: 教室位於雲和街大樓2樓（地址：雲和街1號），外校學生需申請門禁權限。
description: The goal of this course is to help students (1) to have a firm grasp of general phonetics, (2) to be able to produce all types of speech sounds, (3) to be able to perceive all the differences between speech sounds, and (4) to be able to use the IPA transcription symbols to transcribe speech sound when they hear them spoken.

syllabus:
**I. COURSE OVERVIEW**  
This course explores advanced issues in phonetics. Basic acoustics, acoustic analysis of speech sounds, speech production theory, speech physiology, and speech perception will be substantially covered. There will be Praat tutorials in which the instructor will teach students how to analyze speech sounds in a scientific way. Quizzes and exams will be given to examine how well students understand the lectures. Each student will write a term project (10 pages) on a language system of his/her choice. At the end of the semester, students will make an oral presentation on their term project and submit an e-copy of the final paper to the instructor.  
  
**II. COURSE EXPECTATIONS**  
Students are expected to read assigned material, attend class, participate in class discussions, complete assignments, and make regular use of the online learning environment.  
  
**III. COURSE WEBSITE (Moodle 2.8)**  
Please register an account on https://moodle2.ntnu.edu.tw/.  
  
**IV. TEXTBOOK**  
Students are expected to do the assigned readings before the class for which they are listed.

Henning Reetz, Allard Jongman, John Wiley & Sons. 2009. _Phonetics: Transcription, Production, Acoustics, and Perception_. Wiley-Blackwell. \[Required\]  
  
**V. COURSE REQUIREMENTS**  
**1)   Attendance (10%)**  
Attendance at every class is expected and is almost always correlated with better grades. A Notification of Absence Form has to be submitted online (學生請假系統) within 1 week. Late submission will not be accepted. If more than 2 absences occur, the final grade will be deducted by 5 points.  
  
**2)   Praat Assignments (10%)**  
There will be Praat tutorials. Homework will be assigned after the tutorials and should be submitted on Moodle 2.8, not emailed to the professor.  
  
**3)   Quizzes (20%)**  
Quizzes will test your comprehension of material covered in class. There will be 4 quizzes during the course that will be worth 20% of your final grade in total. Each quiz will take less than 20 minutes to complete. The quizzes may be composed of multiple-choice questions OR true/false questions OR labeling a diagram – or other form selected by the instructor. The date of a quiz is scheduled and listed in Section VI. The quizzes will be administered during class.  
  
**4)   Exams (40%)**  
There will be a midterm exam (20%) and a final exam (20%). The exams will predominantly cover material presented in lectures but information from readings (textbook) may be included.  
  
**5)   Term Project (20%)**  
Each student will write a term project on a language system of his/her choice, investigating the consonants, vowels, tones or stress (if any). Students will collect the sound samples from a native speaker of that language and analyze the acoustic characteristics of the speech sounds with use of Praat. Students will make an oral presentation on the findings at the end of the semester and submit a written term project (10 pages, electronically) on Moodle.  

**VI. CLASS SCHEDULE**  
You are expected to do the readings before class on the day they are listed.
